Parameters: The item that is currently selected.
The row that is currently selected.
onItemSelected(java.lang.Object, android.Description: Called when the a row or a new item becomes selected. The concept of current selection is different than focus. Row or item can be selected even they don't have focus. Having the concept of selection will allow developer to switch background to selected item or selected row when user selects rows outside row UI (e.g. headers left of rows). For a none @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRow_E@ case, parameter item is always null. Event is fired when selection changes between rows, regardless if row view has focus or not. For a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRow_E@ case, parameter item can be null if the list row is empty. In the case of a grid, the row parameter is always null. Row has focus: event is fired when focus changes between child of the row. None of the row has focus: the event is fired with the current selected row and last focused item in the row.
onItemSelected(java.lang.Object, android.FullName: public abstract void onItemSelected (Object item, Row row)

ClassDesc: Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#OnItemViewSelectedListener_E@ Interface for receiving notification when a row or item becomes selected.
